Issues.Title: fix(ivy): dissable test which rely on DebugElement in WebWorker
Issues.Body:
Current implementation of `DebugElement` relies on the fact that it can extract information from the `Element` in a lazy fashion. (Previous `DebugRenderer2` implementation eagerly created `DebugElement` and populated it with all of the information.) This is a breaking change for WebWorker implementation if the `WebWorkerRendererFactory2` is combined with `RenderDebug2`, which may be in some tests. (The production build with `RenderDebug2` should continue to work)

The reason we are doing this is that the new `DebugElement` implementation is more lightweight, tree shakable, and does not need `RenderDebug2` factory which means that it can be used form the browser console for quick debugging even of the production apps.  We believe that the new capabilities provide sufficient amount of value to justify breaking the rare case of where `WebWorkerRendererFactory2` is combined with `RenderDebug2`)

<!--

-->
The default `"target"` in `tsconfig.json` generated by `ng new` should be `"es6"`, not `"es5"`.

Reasons:
1. Modern browsers are being optimized for ES6 now. ES5 is no longer necessary or optimal.
2. Smaller generated code files.
3. Fewer problems out-of-the box (without having to use flags that new users might not know about), e.g. https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/3164 

I understand this is a judgement call, and there could be reasons I don't know about to keep the default as es5. If so, I'd like to hear what those are, since I believe it is better to move forward. Apps that have to support Internet Explorer already need to include some polyfills, and I think they're in the minority, so the default should cater to the majority -- users that really *should* be targeting ES6, and may not even think to change the settings in their `tsconfig.json` file.

Issues.Title: Mat Tab breaks animation state by setting to void
Issues.Body:
#### What is the expected behavior?
When Child components of mat-tab have angular animation, the state of the animation should not be affected by switching tabs.

#### What is the current behavior?
When child components of mat-tab have angular animation, switching tabs will cause the state of the animation to be set to void, thus breaking the UI of the child components.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-material2-issue-d8fjgg
In the demo, we have 3 states, expanded state will expand the div height to 300px, collapsed state will collapse the div height to 30px, and void state will set the div height to 150px.
Switching tabs will always reset the div height to 150px, regardless of what the actual current state is.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
Angular 7.0.1

Issues.Body:
